The Thermal Engineering Product Team is looking for a hands-on team member who will contribute through implementing world class validation, characterization, and instrumentation, activities related to development of NVIDIA’s Gaming, High Performance Compute, Automotive, Robotics, and other products. NVIDIA leads the industry and the world with groundbreaking designs and ensuring those products reach their customers flawlessly. You would be a key member of the team and contribute toward extending NVIDIA as a Best Place to Work. What You’ll Be Doing Following set procedures to characterize thermal designs and electronic assemblies: Building-up physical prototype assemblies, instrumenting those assemblies for testing, carrying out testing, summarizing data, disassembling, modifying and reassembling systems. Collaborating with multi-functional teams and implement test plans and collecting data according to those test plans and summarizing data based on predefined templates. Documenting, implementing, and validating test methods based on guidance and discussions with team members. Providing ideas towards our efforts of continuous learning and growth. What We Need To See 2 years related experience. AA degree, or equivalent direct lab experience. Strong testing, troubleshooting, data summary, and organization skills. Hands on proficiency in tear down and buildup of computer hardware, servers, and/or mobile devices. Experience with Windows Software environments. A self-starter that thrives working collaboratively with engineers or independently based on clear instructions from engineer. Experience and familiarity in standard methodologies of maintaining, organizing, and improving the usability of an engineering laboratory. An exceptional naturally collaborative teammate with excellent interpersonal skills (written and verbal). Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd Experience in thermal and/or mechanical testing and evaluation of computer hardware systems Expertise in thermal and mechanical measurement instrumentation, data acquisition, and other methodologies, e.g., thermocouple placement and attach, voltage and current measurements, obtaining readings using automated data acquisition, mechanical assembly and tear downs Experience with Linux Software environments. Strong dedication and experience in providing accurate data with attention to detail, and willingness to complete sometimes extended testing and manual procedures Hands on experience with Windows based systems including loading drivers and BIOS, a Unix command line environment, and potentially modify or write simple scripts for execution Experience and ability to use basic hand tools and devices such as Dremel tools, hand drills, files, metal sheers, wrenches, etc.NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

The Thermal Engineering Product Team is looking for a hands-on team member who will contribute towards developing and implementing world class validation, characterization, instrumentation, processes, and prototyping activities related to development of NVIDIA’s Gaming, High Performance Compute, Automotive, Robotics, and other products. NVIDIA leads the industry and the world with groundbreaking designs and ensuring those products reach their customers flawlessly. You would be a key member of the team and contribute toward extending NVIDIA as a Best Place to Work. What You’ll Be Doing Characterize thermal designs and electronic assemblies: Building-up physical prototype assemblies, instrumenting those assemblies for testing, carrying out testing with specific diagnostic software, summarizing data, disassembling, modifying and reassembling systems Collaborate with cross disciplinary and multi-functional teams to define and implement hardware test plans and collecting data according to plans, performing calculations/analysis, and summarizing data Developing, documenting, implementing, and validating test methods Developing and defining appropriate instrumentation and processes towards our efforts of continuous improvement, learning, and growth What We Need To See Experience in computer/server system level set-up and validation. Expertise in Windows and Linux software as related to set-up, functional testing, and validation of computer hardware systems. Knowledge/experience with thermal evaluation of electronic systems. 3+ years related experience. Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience with direct experience in electronics systems validation. Strong testing, troubleshooting, data summary, documentation, and organization skills. Hands on proficiency in tear down and buildup of computer hardware, servers, and/or mobile devices. An exceptional naturally collaborative self-starter that thrives working collaboratively with other engineering teams or independently. Experience and familiarity in standard methodologies of maintaining, organizing, and improving the usability of an engineering laboratory. Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd Expertise in thermal measurement instrumentation, data acquisition, and other methodologies, e.g., thermocouple placement and attach, voltage and current measurements, obtaining readings using automated data acquisition, mechanical assembly and tear downs. Proficiency in Python or other scripting/programming languages. Fundamental knowledge of heat transfer. Strong dedication and experience in providing accurate data with attention to detail, and willingness to complete sometimes extended testing and manual procedures. Hands on experience with Windows based systems including loading drivers and BIOS, a Unix command line environment, and potentially modify or write simple scripts for execution. Experience and ability to use basic hand tools and devices such as Dremel tools, hand drills, files, metal sheers, wrenches, etc. NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. NVIDIA is the engine of modern artificial intelligence, the biggest technology breakthrough of our time. We are now entering the era of enterprise AI, where every major industry is adopting AI for operational intelligence and breakthroughs, competitive product innovations powered by AI. We uniquely power AI products and applications living at the edge to the datacenter to the cloud. GPU Computing is transforming the industry with AI. You can be a part of the team making it happen. We are looking for a leader to optimize our supply to deliver the short term and long term revenue goals for NVIDIA. We are looking for a VP of our Business Operations function supporting our entire product stack. This position requires cross functional leadership role across business unit, product management, engineering, operations, sales, and finance. The role also includes build planning, transition planning, inventory management. We guide product engineering and operations teams to implement chip supply plans that allow for maximum flexibility and revenue potential. To do all this effectively we look across the entire company portfolio of products and ensure alignment across all groups. You will work with all levels of the organization, from engineering and product teams to ensure the roadmap is scalable for growth, to operations and finance teams to secure our supply base years ahead. Our team manages tactical build plans to support our financial forecasts and works across organizations to optimize for improved financial performance. Do you have have a strong understanding of chip, board and systems engineering development cycles, chip production and system supply chain? Are you passionate joining are a small, high-impact, high-visibility team coordinating operations, engineering, product management and finance across all business segments? If so, we would love to learn more about you. What You'll Be Doing The VP of Business Operations provides leadership in planning, due diligence in implementing sound strategies to achieve business objectives and drive efficient operation of all NVIDIA businesses. Works collaboratively and cross functionally with operations, engineering, sales, finance, and marketing to develop supply plans that meet the businesses needs and optimize revenue, margin. Integrally involved in product planning, launch planning, demand planning, build planning, capacity planning, and inventory management from conception through EOL. Identifies and advocates for tools that can improve operational visibility and efficiency. Exhibits collaborative leadership and excellent open communications skills across key functional organizations from individual contributors through senior executives. Identifies risks and problems in timely manner and drives resolution with speed and agility. Gather and synthesize relevant data, lead analyses and develop final recommendations around strategic and operational initiatives Identify inventory improvement opportunities and support a successful implementation for global optimization initiatives. Monitors demand and anticipate future supply and logistical needs. Reports on inventory levels, inventory health, supply chain progress other KPIs to executive staff What We Need To See 20 years of experience with products including chips, boards and systems. Business knowledge of chip, board and systems engineering development cycles. 20 years of demonstrated leadership in strategic management roles. Demonstrated successful communications skills at executive level. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a highly matrixed organization. Demonstrated excellence in leadership roles and business judgment. Advanced engineering degree (or equivalent experience) and MBA desired. Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd Ability to provide inspirational leadership and drive organizational growth and change Can present complex and technical content to executive staff Demonstrated knowledge in influencing business practices Proven ability to have a strong technical foundation to establish credibility with internal partners Technical knowledge of NVIDIA products and services NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers! We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
